snippet: More than 30 people were arrested in New York on Tuesday, the most since the weekend of March 17, when 73 protesters were held.
abstract: Thousands of protesters converge on Lower and Midtown Manhattan in May Day demonstrations organized by the Occupy Wall Street movement; more than 30 people are arrested on disorderly conduct charges.

byline.original: By ANDY NEWMAN and COLIN MOYNIHAN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Daniel Krieger, Ivan Pereira and Jennifer Preston from New York, and Malia Wollan from Oakland, Calif.

lead_paragraph: More than 30 people were arrested in New York on Tuesday, the most since the weekend of March 17, when 73 protesters were held.

headline.seo: May Day Demonstrations Lead to Clashes and Arrests
headline.main: At May Day Demonstrations, Traffic Jams and Arrests
headline.print_headline: At May Day Demonstrations, Traffic Jams and Arrests
